answers.answer: Hi, I'm sorry you're going through this.  I can't do more than tell you how I dealt with my situation.  I had a large dermoid cyst on one ovary.  I am an obese woman, with diabetes and HBP too.  Because doing surgery on someone as big as me was risky, and because I'm done having kids and pre-menopausal, the doctors and I opted for a complete hysterectomy via abd. surgery.  I had it 04/08, and am feeling worlds better.I know it's very important to keep what you can... and there are reasons for wanting to keep that ovary.  But it's a situation you and your doctor/onc. should evaluate.While I may need HRT down the line, or have complications later, this invasive surgery is something I can only live through once.  I was blessed.If I might suggest, serene thoughtfullness, writing down all your questions, finding peace and comfort and prayer.I can help with the prayer.Keep us posted,Morrowville

Hi,I had a hysterectomy in 2002 but still have my ovaries and have had cysts on and off since then, so I am watching and waiting I guess until I am a tiny bit older and then will have surgery.  I am 39.I wonder why your Doctor is scheduling surgery for May. What sort of surgery?  Is he just assuming that your pain is from scarring?  Have you had u/s or tvus or any other tests done? Do you know for sure that you have a cyst on your ovary.You have not mentioned your age.  I guess if you are having ongoing problems and you are post menopausal then an option would be to have your other ovary removed.If you could post a little bit more information you may get some more defined answers.Good luck and keep us posted.  Love and prayers to ya...Peace....Kim

question: In August of 2007 I had a total hysteroctomy,  my doctor took everything except for my right ovary,  since then AI have been having terrible pains and a pin and needle stabbing sensation where my right ovary is,  my doctor has schedled another surgery in May and he wants to find out what is going on before he extracts the right ovary,   I have told him that I thought all the pain is coming from ovarian cyst,  he says that it is from scar tissue and he can fix it without taking my right ovary out,  but Im afraid that if he dont take the ovary this will become a ongong battle again I have had problems for the past 7 years and thought that is was over with until recently.  Has anyone ever had this happen to them and so what would you suggest take the ovary or leave it?  Thanks
title: ovarian cyst after hystereoctomy
